title: JOSETTE SHEERAN OF UNITED STATES APPOINTED TO HEAD WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME | Meetings Coverage and Press Releases

quotes:
7 November 2006
JOSETTE SHEERAN OF UNITED STATES APPOINTED TO HEAD WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME

organizations.name: World Food Programme (WFP)
quotes: United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Director-General Jacques Diouf announced today their appointment of Josette Sheeran (  United   States) as Executive Director of the World Food Programme (WFP), in succession to James Morris.

organizations.name: United Nations
quotes: United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Director-General Jacques Diouf announced today their appointment of Josette Sheeran (  United   States) as Executive Director of the World Food Programme (WFP), in succession to James Morris.

organizations.name: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)
quotes: United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Director-General Jacques Diouf announced today their appointment of Josette Sheeran (  United   States) as Executive Director of the World Food Programme (WFP), in succession to James Morris.

organizations.name: State Department
quotes: Ms. Sheeran has a 20-year proven track record as a management leader, including overseeing the State Department’s economic diplomatic corps of 2,000.

organizations.name: Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR)
quotes: Prior to her appointment as Under Secretary, Ms. Sheeran served as Deputy United States Trade Representative in the Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR).

organizations.name: Starpoint Solutions
quotes: Before joining USTR, she was managing director of Starpoint Solutions, a leading Wall Street technology firm that works with Fortune 500 clients.

organizations.name: Empower America
quotes: She also served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Empower  America, a   Washington,  D.C., think tank, where she advanced the agenda of economic empowerment for inner cities and developing nations.

organizations.name: Washington Times
quotes: She was managing editor of the Washington Times and has twice served as a Pulitzer Prize juror, including for foreign reporting.

organizations.name: High-Level United Nations Panel on System-wide
quotes: Ms. Sheeran was appointed by the Secretary-General to the High-Level United Nations Panel on System-wide

roles.title: Executive Director of the World Food Programme (WFP)
quotes: United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Director-General Jacques Diouf announced today their appointment of Josette Sheeran (  United   States) as Executive Director of the World Food Programme (WFP), in succession to James Morris.

roles.title: Under Secretary of State for Economic, Business and Agricultural Affairs
quotes: Ms. Sheeran currently serves as Under Secretary of State for Economic, Business and Agricultural Affairs where she is responsible for economic issues including development, trade, agriculture, finance, energy, telecommunications and transportation.

roles.title: Deputy United States Trade Representative
quotes: Prior to her appointment as Under Secretary, Ms. Sheeran served as Deputy United States Trade Representative in the Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR).

JOSETTE SHEERAN of United States APPOINTED TO HEAD WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME
Department of Public Information • News and Media Division • New York

She also served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Empower  America, a   Washington,  D.C., think tank, where she advanced the agenda of economic empowerment for inner cities and developing nations.

supporting_quotes:
7 November 2006
JOSETTE SHEERAN OF UNITED STATES APPOINTED TO HEAD WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME

United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Director-General Jacques Diouf announced today their appointment of Josette Sheeran (  United   States) as Executive Director of the World Food Programme (WFP), in succession to James Morris.
